commit_message:
oslo-config-validator: Removing merged patches

While developing this, we discovered a lot of inconsistencies across the
openstack projects. These inconsistencies are now fixed, at least on the
master branch so we can now remove them from the exceptions.

This change I70ab87c9bed093cad883b6301b8a09753fc470d9 was merged so the
yaml bug we found in the generator is now fixed across all the branches.
It's now safe to remove the builtin patch.

Also, os_vif now supports list_opts
(I7fc132f917949d147dd6371d54e01a6cfd995aae) so we can use it to template
the vif_plug_(ovs|linux_bridge) sections. As opposed to cinder, there's
no reference section so we need to statically define them.

Change-Id: I6f86ce6b135be9841b5fcae1f940c829327a2db2
(cherry picked from commit 63f881be6e759e91b008fa25894bd07e1403dbf3)

subject: oslo-config-validator: invalidating configs only when necessary
messages: [{'account_id': 27419, 'date': '2021-10-11 13:30:26.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Cherry Picked from branch master.'}, {'account_id': 27419, 'date': '2021-10-11 13:31:32.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Patch Set 1 was rebased'}, {'account_id': 16515, 'date': '2021-10-11 19:53:59.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Code-Review+2 Workflow+1'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2021-10-11 13:30:26.000000000', 'message': 'oslo-config-validator: invalidating configs only when necessary

Some nodes with no settings to invalidate as per their role will have
an empty config_invalidations list thus breaking the related tasks and
returning an error.

Skipping these tasks when config_invalidations is undefined will prevent
this false negative and will not block other nodes from runnnig the
tasks.

Also, adding some defaults to prevent failures when items are missing
from config.

Change-Id: Ib3ca74caf747c13937a4efa8c20a6fd789ede43b
(cherry picked from commit 9c62de3d4c5f0c78445b450da917a6183e81f93b)

commit_message:
oslo-config-validator: invalidating configs only when necessary

Some nodes with no settings to invalidate as per their role will have
an empty config_invalidations list thus breaking the related tasks and
returning an error.

Skipping these tasks when config_invalidations is undefined will prevent
this false negative and will not block other nodes from runnnig the
tasks.

Also, adding some defaults to prevent failures when items are missing
from config.

Change-Id: Ib3ca74caf747c13937a4efa8c20a6fd789ede43b
(cherry picked from commit 9c62de3d4c5f0c78445b450da917a6183e81f93b)

commit_message:
haproxy: Use healthcheck API for Ironic and Octavia

The healthcheck API is now enabled in Ironic and Octavia so we can
replace the API endpoint used to check service status.

Conflicts:
	manifests/haproxy.pp

Depends-on: https://review.opendev.org/810190
Change-Id: I3a412e393647598f3607279b4741373bab07595e

This lgtm, and I cross checked a couple of ways against cinder's xena policies.

2. Deployed a standalone system with this env file, and grabbed a copy of /etc/cinder/policy.yaml

commit_message:
Implement project personas in custom cinder policy file

This commit updates the default cinder policies in
enable-secure-rbac.yaml to implement consistent support for project
personas (project-admin, project-member, and project-reader) with other
OpenStack services. The project-admin is still considered a system
administrator.

This behavior will change in future releases (likely Yoga) when we have
a community wide goal to finish system-scope adoption. At that point, we
can remove these overrides and use the defaults in cinder, which should
adhere to system and project personas and we'll get more functionality
without these overrides.

Change-Id: Ic8199cb3eaa23476157be0f3b69d2ee08f77f17b

commit_message:
Remove six library

The six library was used to bridge the py2 > py3
gap. This library is longer required on branches
that do not support Python2.

Change-Id: I40cb90bc6bc058dcbf3659b97dbb489b53adb9d3

messages:
[{'account_id': 15343, 'date': '2020-12-04 21:21:30.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 26274, 'date': '2020-12-07 10:15:38.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 2.'}, {'account_id': 26274, 'date': '2020-12-07 10:42:39.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Code-Review+1

Before submitting the bug report, I was trying to zero-pad the segments. But indeed, it is tricky, and requires to deal with already started multipart uploads.

This simpler solution will do the job.'}, {'account_id': 15343, 'date': '2020-12-08 06:20:18.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Code-Review+2

recheck

Thanks for the fix-up!'}, {'account_id': 7847, 'date': '2020-12-18 14:52:32.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2: Code-Review-1

(4 comments)

nice work, but -1 because I'm not sure the fix allows for the config max parts varying from the default, and because the tests could be tightened up"}, {'account_id': 15343, 'date': '2021-01-09 01:14:30.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

(1 comment)'}, {'account_id': 15343, 'date': '2021-01-09 01:14:36.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 3.'}, {'account_id': 15343, 'date': '2021-01-09 03:09:37.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3:

recheck'}, {'account_id': 17363, 'date': '2021-09-28 00:26:21.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 3: Code-Review-1

I don't believe this patch is sufficient. Consider an MPU with 2000 parts (for example), so Swift would return the objects like this:
1, 10, ..., 100, ..., 1000, ..., 1100, ..., etc. The last returned object would be 1899. I think we need to (possibly) make multiple requests and set the limit to `max_upload_part_num`. I opened this review to try to address the problem: https://review.opendev.org/c/openstack/swift/+/811247"}, {'account_id': 15343, 'date': '2021-10-11 23:25:34.000000000', 'content': 'Abandoned

Superseded by https://review.opendev.org/c/openstack/swift/+/811247'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2020-12-04 21:21:30.000000000', 'message': "s3api: Fix limited part listings with more than 9 parts

Previously, when a user requested limited part listings, two bad things
could happen:

 * For the initial request, the proxy wouldn't have the full list of
   parts to sort, causing us to omit some uploaded parts (often, parts
   2-9).

 * For the subsequent request with a part-number-marker param, we
   wouldn't include any sort of marker in the request to the container
   server, causing us to get *the same set of parts*, all of which would
   be filtered out in the proxy.

This is because we don't zero-pad part numbers in the +segments
container, so we need to look at all uploaded parts to determine the
correct order to return them.

Note that padding the part numbers will be a little tricky since
there's already data on disk out there with non-padded numbers.

Closes-Bug: #1906854
Co-Authored-By: Tim Burke <tim.burke@gmail.com>
Change-Id: I2c6a50a0b4f29ee281ee561a7532b09134399419
"}, {'created': '2020-12-07 10:15:38.000000000', 'message': "s3api: Fix limited part listings with more than 9 parts

   wouldn't include any sort of marker in the request to the container
   server, causing us to get *the same set of parts*, all of which would
   be filtered out in the proxy.

This is because we don't zero-pad part numbers in the +segments
container, so we need to look at all uploaded parts to determine the
correct order to return them.

Note that padding the part numbers will be a little tricky since
there's already data on disk out there with non-padded numbers.

Closes-Bug: #1906854
Co-Authored-By: Tim Burke <tim.burke@gmail.com>
Change-Id: I2c6a50a0b4f29ee281ee561a7532b09134399419
"}, {'created': '2021-01-09 01:14:36.000000000', 'message': "s3api: Fix limited part listings with more than 9 parts

Previously, when a user requested limited part listings, two bad things
could happen:

 * For the initial request, the proxy wouldn't have the full list of
   parts to sort, causing us to omit some uploaded parts (often, parts
   2-9).

 * For the subsequent request with a part-number-marker param, we
   wouldn't include any sort of marker in the request to the container
   server, causing us to get *the same set of parts*, all of which would
   be filtered out in the proxy.

This is because we don't zero-pad part numbers in the +segments
container, so we need to look at all uploaded parts to determine the
correct order to return them.

Note that padding the part numbers will be a little tricky since
there's already data on disk out there with non-padded numbers.

Closes-Bug: #1906854
Co-Authored-By: Tim Burke <tim.burke@gmail.com>

commit_message:
s3api: Fix limited part listings with more than 9 parts

Previously, when a user requested limited part listings, two bad things
could happen:

 * For the initial request, the proxy wouldn't have the full list of
   parts to sort, causing us to omit some uploaded parts (often, parts
   2-9).

 * For the subsequent request with a part-number-marker param, we
   wouldn't include any sort of marker in the request to the container
   server, causing us to get *the same set of parts*, all of which would
   be filtered out in the proxy.

This is because we don't zero-pad part numbers in the +segments
container, so we need to look at all uploaded parts to determine the
correct order to return them.

Note that padding the part numbers will be a little tricky since
there's already data on disk out there with non-padded numbers.

Closes-Bug: #1906854

commit_message:
Use Ceph Pacific for devstack-plugin-ceph-tempest-py3 jobs

Move tempest py3 jobs to latest released stable Ceph, which is
Pacific.

Depends-On: I5fa2105ceb3b97a4e38926d76c1e4028f1108d4a
Change-Id: I6cd5424f023d2a895f8ed259d21944490bc1de5f
(cherry picked from commit ea0c1c768c99437504a1a6f2971dd0c5c1563ca5)

commit_message:
Add --boot-mode to import and configure

The commands `openstack overcloud node import` and `openstack
overcloud node configure` now have a --boot-mode arguement which
allows the boot mode for all affected nodes to be set to UEFI boot
(uefi) or legacy BIOS boot (bios).

It is expected --boot-mode=bios will only be required when specific
nodes have issues with UEFI boot, or on architectures which don't
support it (Power)

Change-Id: Idee25f23652a8e7435a31842d4a2d838543607ae
Depends-On: https://review.opendev.org/c/openstack/tripleo-heat-templates/+/805732
Blueprint: whole-disk-default
(cherry picked from commit ae6958a86216c5ffd1b1513ec110c4cb08f54b00)

commit_message:
Fix typos in application credential policies

We updated these policies when we introduces system scope and default
roles, but the policy names accidentally changed, which makes the policy
files render with an alias because oslo.policy thinks the names are
changing.

Conflicts:
      keystone/common/policies/application_credential.py in later
      releases the deprecated parameters were moved from the
      DocumentedRuleDefault object to the DeprecatedRule object, which
      is a non-functional change.

Change-Id: I1121f1abe769ee83ffc285103a95ee95540ce727
(cherry picked from commit 60e898c47038667e66a54e0a9a6cd7b91e115f55)
(cherry picked from commit 7b28f1b3b47d0e4a22afe99c64d047016a772da5)

commit_message:
Remove helm status from deployment scripts

With the move to helm v3, helm status requires a namespace to be
specified, but doing so breaks helm v2 compatability. In order
to preserve our gating with both versions of helm while we make
the change from v2 to v3, this change removes the usage of helm
serve in openstack-helm's deployment scripts.

Once we fully move to helm v3, these scripts can be improved and
cleaned up to be more compatible with the new v3 syntax.

Change-Id: I02b6bbf780abf8c8bc7c1783c35d9411d25e18a8

commit_message:
Fix typos in ec2 credential policies

There was a trailing s in two of these policies and it caused the policy
names to mismatch, which causes confusion with the rendered policy files
and potentially causes uses with deprecation logic.

Change-Id: I54021986d17c57d7733d53caa4032c2767eaf25e

commit_message:
Fix docs jobs and pep8 errors with pylint 2.6.2

Remove test-requirements.txt from docs dependencies, add hacking in
doc/requirements. It should reduce the duration of the docs job.

Removed some comments that disabled consider-using-with in pylint,
most of the flagged code is now considered as false positive.

Change-Id: Ib550542820163be2bbef97df7b090834a6b6dccd

commit_message:
Fix typos in application credential policies

We updated these policies when we introduces system scope and default
roles, but the policy names accidentally changed, which makes the policy
files render with an alias because oslo.policy thinks the names are
changing.

Conflicts:
      keystone/common/policies/application_credential.py in later
      releases the deprecated parameters were moved from the
      DocumentedRuleDefault object to the DeprecatedRule object, which
      is a non-functional change.

Change-Id: I1121f1abe769ee83ffc285103a95ee95540ce727
(cherry picked from commit 60e898c47038667e66a54e0a9a6cd7b91e115f55)
(cherry picked from commit 7b28f1b3b47d0e4a22afe99c64d047016a772da5)
(cherry picked from commit 14d2f5944ce9ef0cc881b91463df7cf3a1114d5b)

commit_message:
GaneshaNetwork - fallback -> external -> ctlplane

The GaneshaNetwork attempted to fallback to the external
network in the case when storage_nfs network does not
exists. It should also fallback to ctlplane in the case that
the external network does not exist.

Related-Bug: #1946239
Change-Id: I5804621a3081209bbae63193c1e09601826f4275

commit_message:
Allow LVM filter to work when either allowlist or denylist are empty

Fixes the LVM filter task for it to build correctly formatted lists
when either one of allowlist or denylist are empty.

The depend-on change switches rabbit's nodename to FQDN and adds
the CA in the config. This puppet change does the following:
1. Switches the default ssl versions to 1.2 and 1.3
2. Drops the old hard-coded cipher list that used to be needed to avoid
   falling back to tls 1.0
3. Introduce a verify_peer_{client,server} parameter. The former is set
   to verify_peer by default, so that rabbitmq 3.9 does not emit
   warnings (see original LP description)
4. Splits off all erlang ssl parameters to a separate file called
   /etc/rabbitmq/ssl-dist.conf. Reason for this is that it is cleaner
   and not all configurable items are supported by erlang as command
   line arguments. (In particular the ssl versions)
5. Make sure we pass the custom CA inside the HA bundle

Tested as follows:

   rabbitmq 3.9 + erlang 24.1 stack
B. Made sure that only tls1.2 and/or tls1.3 are allowed on port 5672
   and 25672

[root@controller-0 ~]# openssl s_client -connect controller-0.internalapi.home.arpa:5672 -CAfile /etc/ipa/ca.crt -verify_hostname controller-0.internalapi.home.arpa -tls1_1 |grep ^New; echo $?
00CCA0CAB37F0000:error:0A00042E:SSL routines:ssl3_read_bytes:tlsv1 alert protocol version:ssl/record/rec_layer_s3.c:1584:SSL alert number 70
New, (NONE), Cipher is (NONE)
0

depth=1 O = HOME.ARPA, CN = Certificate Authority
verify return:1
depth=0 O = HOME.ARPA, CN = controller-0.internalapi.home.arpa
verify return:1
New, TLSv1.2, Cipher is ECDHE-RSA-AES256-GCM-SHA384
0

depth=1 O = HOME.ARPA, CN = Certificate Authority
verify return:1
depth=0 O = HOME.ARPA, CN = controller-0.internalapi.home.arpa
verify return:1
New, TLSv1.3, Cipher is TLS_AES_256_GCM_SHA384
0

commit_message:
Modernize rabbitmq's TLS support

The depend-on change switches rabbit's nodename to FQDN and adds
the CA in the config. This puppet change does the following:
1. Switches the default tls versions to 1.2 and 1.3
2. Drops the old hard-coded cipher list that used to be needed to avoid
   falling back to tls 1.0
3. Introduce a verify_peer_{client,server} parameter. The former is set
   to verify_peer by default, so that rabbitmq 3.9 does not emit
   warnings (see original LP description)
4. Splits off all erlang ssl parameters to a separate file called
   /etc/rabbitmq/ssl-dist.conf. Reason for this is that it is cleaner
   and not all configurable items are supported by erlang as command
   line arguments. (In particular the ssl versions)
5. Make sure we pass the custom CA inside the HA bundle (this had to
   be split out to Ib0236f9c086d520d0a27e3aa8b41927bc7b50c26
   (Bind mount the IPA crt when internal_tls is enabled) for CI to pass
   on all reviews.

Tested as follows:
A. Deployed and run tempest against a TLS-E overcloud that uses as
   rabbitmq 3.9 + erlang 24.1 stack
B. Made sure that only tls1.2 and/or tls1.3 are allowed on port 5672
   and 25672

[root@controller-0 ~]# openssl s_client -connect controller-0.internalapi.home.arpa:5672 -CAfile /etc/ipa/ca.crt -verify_hostname controller-0.internalapi.home.arpa -tls1_1 |grep ^New
00CCA0CAB37F0000:error:0A00042E:SSL routines:ssl3_read_bytes:tlsv1 alert protocol version:ssl/record/rec_layer_s3.c:1584:SSL alert number 70
New, (NONE), Cipher is (NONE)

[root@controller-0 ~]# openssl s_client -connect controller-0.internalapi.home.arpa:5672 -CAfile /etc/ipa/ca.crt -verify_hostname controller-0.internalapi.home.arpa -tls1_2 |grep ^New
depth=1 O = HOME.ARPA, CN = Certificate Authority
verify return:1
depth=0 O = HOME.ARPA, CN = controller-0.internalapi.home.arpa
verify return:1
New, TLSv1.2, Cipher is ECDHE-RSA-AES256-GCM-SHA384

[root@controller-0 ~]# openssl s_client -connect controller-0.internalapi.home.arpa:5672 -CAfile /etc/ipa/ca.crt -verify_hostname controller-0.internalapi.home.arpa -tls1_3 |grep ^New
depth=1 O = HOME.ARPA, CN = Certificate Authority
verify return:1
depth=0 O = HOME.ARPA, CN = controller-0.internalapi.home.arpa
verify return:1
New, TLSv1.3, Cipher is TLS_AES_256_GCM_SHA384

Closes-Bug: #1946374

Co-Authored-By: John Eckersberg <jeckersb@redhat.com>

Depends-On: I621557a037fbedc5c110f905dbe19290cc92b772

Change-Id: I4f853de3b532b3b5e71d29aa621a2925c3885393

commit_message:
Revert "Revert "Allow for OCI manifests""

Add support for OCI manifests and includes a fix to handle the
schemaVersion 1 metadata which is used by the prometheus
containers upstream.

This reverts commit b2f76f8514baefb57e10c9a5562457b651ec29af.

Change-Id: I352cd33578eeb447d3a36cbca7767b1bfd5de7aa
Depends-On: https://review.opendev.org/c/openstack/tripleo-ci/+/812506
Related-Bug: #1860585
(cherry picked from commit 3f2853b9a2e6f7de16bf928721aa2b3b4fa5c801)

commit_message:
Fix typo in identity provider policies

This cause the sample generated policy file to alias the old name with
the new policy name, which isn't needed since we're not renaming these
policies at all and it was likely a typo.

Conflicts:
      keystone/common/policies/identity_provider.py
      In later releases the deprecation parameters were moved up to the
      deprecated options and not in the DocumentedRule defaults.

Change-Id: Idfd9adbbe800bbc21814d94002a2b61524cce28a
(cherry picked from commit c10d5c88ef40e63d4dfefb792d6c3d68acd72dd9)
(cherry picked from commit bdd8f82f60d2e46e5f6951c4407366b89591cde5)

commit_message:
Switch to rabbitmq fqdn hostnames and pass proper CA info

With this change we make sure that the 'RABBITMQ_NODENAME' is the fqdn
and that we use it when connecting to the node itself via rabbitmqctl.
We also make sure we set the CA to the one defined in the InternalTLSCAFile
template parameter.

Testing protocol is described in the parent change
("I4f853de3b532b3b5e71d29aa621a2925c3885393")

Related-Bug: #1946374

Depends-On: Ib0236f9c086d520d0a27e3aa8b41927bc7b50c26
Change-Id: I621557a037fbedc5c110f905dbe19290cc92b772

In order for later reviews to make use of the FreeIPA internal
CA we need to first bind mount it within the container.

We need to add a default in the hiera definition (/etc/ipa/ca.crt)
in order to break a cyclic dependency on the subsequent patches.

commit_message:
Bind mount the IPA crt when internal_tls is enabled

In order for later reviews to make use of the FreeIPA internal
CA we need to first bind mount it within the container.

We need to add a default in the hiera definition (/etc/ipa/ca.crt)
in order to break a cyclic dependency on the subsequent patches.
(THT child change will set the rabbitmq::ssl_cacert key)

Related-Bug: #1946374
Change-Id: Ib0236f9c086d520d0a27e3aa8b41927bc7b50c26

commit_message:
ic: add support for OVN_IC_Northbound schema

This change provides 'OvnIcNbApiIdlImpl' class for interaction with
'ovn_ic_nb.db' and adds functions and commands to add, delete and list
rows of 'Transit_Switch' table in 'OVN_IC_Northbound' schema.

Closes-Bug: 1944441

Change-Id: I322f05c1a91113a9470218946b7ce151a63737be

commit_message:
Fix typos in application credential policies

We updated these policies when we introduces system scope and default
roles, but the policy names accidentally changed, which makes the policy
files render with an alias because oslo.policy thinks the names are
changing.

Conflicts:
      keystone/common/policies/application_credential.py in later
      releases the deprecated parameters were moved from the
      DocumentedRuleDefault object to the DeprecatedRule object, which
      is a non-functional change.

Change-Id: I1121f1abe769ee83ffc285103a95ee95540ce727
(cherry picked from commit 60e898c47038667e66a54e0a9a6cd7b91e115f55)
(cherry picked from commit 7b28f1b3b47d0e4a22afe99c64d047016a772da5)

commit_message:
[HA] Do not add initial state change delay in HA router

The initial state ("primary", "backup") should be set immediately.
in [1], a transition delay to "primary" was introduced. This delay
is unnecesary when the first state happens.

Closes-Bug: #1945512

[1]https://review.opendev.org/q/I70037da9cdd0f8448e0af8dd96b4e3f5de5728ad

Change-Id: Ibe9178c4126977f1321e414676d67f28e5ec9b57

commit_message:
Fix typos in ec2 credential policies

There was a trailing s in two of these policies and it caused the policy
names to mismatch, which causes confusion with the rendered policy files
and potentially causes uses with deprecation logic.

Change-Id: I54021986d17c57d7733d53caa4032c2767eaf25e
(cherry picked from commit 82da8824df0f56ef4e137805bf32d647cef1ea59)

commit_message:
Set explicit boot mode to bios for legacy job

The default boot mode for ironic is now uefi [1]
The legacy jobs should set IRONIC_BOOT_MODE explicitely to bios.

[1] https://opendev.org/openstack/ironic/commit/493b4f0caf591caeaa3285c7f597a54121d99985

Change-Id: If5c8feb3a829eaff56519846de3e5ccd6bab24c4

commit_message:
Use cinder defaults for cinder_management_address

ansible_host might be not always safe default and instead we would use
management_address that is set as a default in cinder role.

Depends-On: https://review.opendev.org/c/openstack/openstack-ansible-os_cinder/+/805989
Related-Bug: #1941068
Change-Id: Icbfe86d984774dbb412f643cecc62b6a5f683918

revisions:
[{'created': '2021-10-05 02:39:26.000000000', 'message': "oslo-config-validator: Removing merged patches

While developing this, we discovered a lot of inconsistencies across the
openstack projects. These inconsistencies are now fixed, at least on the
master branch so we can now remove them from the exceptions.

This change I70ab87c9bed093cad883b6301b8a09753fc470d9 was merged so the
yaml bug we found in the generator is now fixed across all the branches.
It's now safe to remove the builtin patch.

Also, os_vif now supports list_opts
(I7fc132f917949d147dd6371d54e01a6cfd995aae) so we can use it to template
the vif_plug_(ovs|linux_bridge) sections. As opposed to cinder, there's
no reference section so we need to statically define them.

Change-Id: I6f86ce6b135be9841b5fcae1f940c829327a2db2
"}, {'created': '2021-10-05 14:59:59.000000000', 'message': "oslo-config-validator: Removing merged patches

While developing this, we discovered a lot of inconsistencies across the
openstack projects. These inconsistencies are now fixed, at least on the
master branch so we can now remove them from the exceptions.

This change I70ab87c9bed093cad883b6301b8a09753fc470d9 was merged so the
yaml bug we found in the generator is now fixed across all the branches.
It's now safe to remove the builtin patch.

Also, os_vif now supports list_opts
(I7fc132f917949d147dd6371d54e01a6cfd995aae) so we can use it to template
the vif_plug_(ovs|linux_bridge) sections. As opposed to cinder, there's
no reference section so we need to statically define them.

Change-Id: I6f86ce6b135be9841b5fcae1f940c829327a2db2
"}, {'created': '2021-10-05 22:52:35.000000000', 'message': "oslo-config-validator: Removing merged patches

While developing this, we discovered a lot of inconsistencies across the
openstack projects. These inconsistencies are now fixed, at least on the
master branch so we can now remove them from the exceptions.

This change I70ab87c9bed093cad883b6301b8a09753fc470d9 was merged so the
yaml bug we found in the generator is now fixed across all the branches.
It's now safe to remove the builtin patch.

Also, os_vif now supports list_opts
(I7fc132f917949d147dd6371d54e01a6cfd995aae) so we can use it to template
the vif_plug_(ovs|linux_bridge) sections. As opposed to cinder, there's

commit_message:
oslo-config-validator: Removing merged patches

While developing this, we discovered a lot of inconsistencies across the
openstack projects. These inconsistencies are now fixed, at least on the
master branch so we can now remove them from the exceptions.

This change I70ab87c9bed093cad883b6301b8a09753fc470d9 was merged so the
yaml bug we found in the generator is now fixed across all the branches.
It's now safe to remove the builtin patch.

Also, os_vif now supports list_opts
(I7fc132f917949d147dd6371d54e01a6cfd995aae) so we can use it to template
the vif_plug_(ovs|linux_bridge) sections. As opposed to cinder, there's
no reference section so we need to statically define them.

Change-Id: I6f86ce6b135be9841b5fcae1f940c829327a2db2

commit_message:
oslo-config-validator: container plugin is replaced with collections

Adding collections to meta will prevent failure as well as keeping the
code clean and concise.

also rewriting mock code because it doesn't work with collections.

Change-Id: I28070098ccd432b4f17ab145c2afc296e5d2bb69

revisions:
[{'created': '2021-09-22 17:19:43.000000000', 'message': '[oslo-config-validator] invalidating configs only when necessary

Some nodes with no settings to invalidate as per their role will have
an empty config_invalidations list thus breaking the related tasks and
returning an error.

Skipping these tasks when config_invalidations is undefined will prevent
this false negative and will not block other nodes from runnnig the
tasks.

Change-Id: Ib3ca74caf747c13937a4efa8c20a6fd789ede43b

commit_message:
oslo-config-validator: invalidating configs only when necessary

Some nodes with no settings to invalidate as per their role will have
an empty config_invalidations list thus breaking the related tasks and
returning an error.

Skipping these tasks when config_invalidations is undefined will prevent
this false negative and will not block other nodes from runnnig the
tasks.

Also, adding some defaults to prevent failures when items are missing
from config.

Change-Id: Ib3ca74caf747c13937a4efa8c20a6fd789ede43b

commit_message:
Disable network on for centos9 image build

When testing C9 image build with [1] we hit related bug. This
works around the issue by disabling the explicit network on.

[1] https://review.rdoproject.org/r/c/testproject/+/35465/
Related-Bug: 1945589

Change-Id: I8500a93f85c39c44361109281ee7a4cac637592f

commit_message:
Add support for Vault Namespaces

Vault Namespaces [0] is a feature available in Vault Enterprise that
can be considered as a more advanced isolation feature on top of current
KV Mountpoint option in Castellan Vault plugin.

Passing a namespace in all request headers (including Auth) allows to organize
Vault-in-Vault style of isolation, with clients using the same simple URI path
but accessing separate sets of entities in Vault.

[0] https://www.vaultproject.io/docs/enterprise/namespaces

Change-Id: I627c20002bb2a0a1b346b57e824f87f856eca4c9

commit_message:
Deprecate and ignore --skip-nodes-and-networks

Based on discussions make '--baremtal-deployment' option
control wheater nodes, networks and virtual IPs are
provisioned and deprecate --skip-nodes-and-networks for
removal.

When '--baremetal-deployment' is used without an argument
the dynamic default in the working dir is used. When a
baremetal deployment file is passed as the argument the
file passed is placed in the working dir as the dynamic
default and then used for provisioning.

Change-Id: Idaab1f28c4d645279eff0c01b24435bf8571299b

commit_message:
Run TripleO jobs on CentOS8 instead of CentOS7

As we are cleaning up the c7 jobs and obselete featuresets [1].
This change replaces usage of CentOS7 in TripleO jobs by CentOS8.

[1]: https://review.opendev.org/q/topic:%22cleanup_featuresets%22+(status:open%20OR%20status:merged)

Change-Id: I82db78daa37fe27455c9ff349b0dc09501600152

revisions:
[{'created': '2021-09-15 16:53:48.000000000', 'message': 'Update TOX_CONSTRAINTS_FILE for stable/xena

Update the URL to the upper-constraints file to point to the redirect
rule on releases.openstack.org so that anyone working on this branch
will switch to the correct upper-constraints list automatically when
the requirements repository branches.

Until the requirements repository has as stable/xena branch, tests will
continue to use the upper-constraints list on master.

Change-Id: Ie8bc186e7bc969324b4c25a3ebb76be034a9fc4a
'}]
commit_message:
Update TOX_CONSTRAINTS_FILE for stable/xena

Update the URL to the upper-constraints file to point to the redirect
rule on releases.openstack.org so that anyone working on this branch
will switch to the correct upper-constraints list automatically when
the requirements repository branches.

Until the requirements repository has as stable/xena branch, tests will
continue to use the upper-constraints list on master.

Change-Id: Ie8bc186e7bc969324b4c25a3ebb76be034a9fc4a

Weight for haproxy backend was merged in [1] with
tiny bug, there is need to convert to int to check
conditional <= 256. Otherwise, it's not working as
expected.

[1] https://review.opendev.org/c/openstack/kolla-ansible/+/775627

commit_message:
Trivial but necessary fix - loadbalancer weight

Weight for haproxy backend was merged in [1] with
tiny bug, there is need to convert to int to check
conditional <= 256. Otherwise, it's not working as
expected.

[1] https://review.opendev.org/c/openstack/kolla-ansible/+/775627

Change-Id: Icb6f5147ebd2a0be52ba4ef6ba4a00bbd0242d3d

commit_message:
Move jobs to use Ubuntu Focal

According to the docs[0] Ubuntu Focal is the
version supported for Xena. This commit
updates the jobs and the Amphora image.

[0] https://governance.openstack.org/tc/reference/runtimes/xena.html
Depends-On: https://review.opendev.org/c/openstack/kuryr-kubernetes/+/812154

Change-Id: I869040d9b05ef3d1cded5f91e1634214b83fd348

revisions:
[{'created': '2021-09-30 16:38:07.000000000', 'message': "Make completed Pods Ports reusable

When the Pod has status Completed it has finalized
its job, consequently it's expected that Kuryr will
reclycle the Neutron Ports associated with it to be
used by other Pods. However, Kuryr is considering
Completed Pods as not scheduled and the event is skipped.
This commit fixes the issue by ensuring that Completed
Pods Ports recycle is done before checking for Scheduled
Pods.

Change-Id: I23e7901fb016d59fa76762d1f24fee47974e72df
"}, {'created': '2021-09-30 16:53:16.000000000', 'message': "Make completed Pods Ports reusable

When the Pod has status Completed it has finalized
its job, consequently it's expected that Kuryr will
reclycle the Neutron Ports associated with it to be
used by other Pods. However, Kuryr is considering
Completed Pods as not scheduled and the event is skipped.
This commit fixes the issue by ensuring that Completed
Pods Ports recycle is done before checking for Scheduled
Pods.

Closes-Bug: #1945680
Change-Id: I23e7901fb016d59fa76762d1f24fee47974e72df
"}, {'created': '2021-10-06 10:52:18.000000000', 'message': "Make completed Pods Ports reusable

used by other Pods. However, Kuryr is considering
Completed Pods as not scheduled and the event is skipped.
This commit fixes the issue by ensuring that Completed
Pods Ports recycle is done before checking for Scheduled
Pods.

Closes-Bug: #1945680
Change-Id: I23e7901fb016d59fa76762d1f24fee47974e72df
"}]
commit_message:
Make completed Pods Ports reusable

When the Pod has status Completed it has finalized
its job, consequently it's expected that Kuryr will
reclycle the Neutron Ports associated with it to be
used by other Pods. However, Kuryr is considering
Completed Pods as not scheduled and the event is skipped.
This commit fixes the issue by ensuring that Completed
Pods Ports recycle is done before checking for Scheduled
Pods.

Closes-Bug: #1945680
Change-Id: I23e7901fb016d59fa76762d1f24fee47974e72df

commit_message:
[DVR] Check if SNAT iptables manager is initialized

Check if SNAT iptables manager is initialized before processing the
IP NAT rules. If the router never had an external GW port, the DVR
GW in the SNAT namespace has not been created and the SNAT iptables
manager has not been initialized.

In this case, the IP NAT rules for centralized FIPs (to be applied
on the SNAT namespace) cannot be set.

Conflicts:
    neutron/tests/functional/agent/l3/framework.py

Closes-Bug: #1945215
Change-Id: I426602514805d728f8cd78e42f2b0979b2101089
(cherry picked from commit f18edfdf450179f6bc8a47f3b143f2701bd93e0e)
(cherry picked from commit b9143c37e06567b1ce50f9e858c9289984bb8e4b)

messages: [{'account_id': 30073, 'date': '2021-10-10 22:02:23.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Cherry Picked from branch master.'}, {'account_id': 28223, 'date': '2021-10-11 06:24:39.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+1'}, {'account_id': 30073, 'date': '2021-10-11 06:39:09.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Workflow-1'}, {'account_id': 30073, 'date': '2021-10-11 10:11:54.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: -Workflow'}, {'account_id': 8833, 'date': '2021-10-11 11:01:11.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2 Workflow+1'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2021-10-10 22:02:23.000000000', 'message': "Don't create deployment when changing transport

Earlier when changing software config transport we used to
create a dummy deployment to push the metadata. However
this would not work with convergence as we take
resource lock for the update which updates the config
transport (another engine would try to update the resource
metadata for deployment when one engine has locked it).

Currently it works when updating transport as we ignore
the error in creating dummy deployment, but if there are
any new depoyments for the server they would fail.

We don't need to push the metadata as it would be pushed
when the there is a new/updated deployment.

Few additional changes in the patch:

- We don't need to ignore the error as servers are now
not replaced if the resource is in ERROR when nova server
is good/ACTIVE.
- Delete the existing tempurls and zaqar queues when
  changing transport.

Task: 41744
Change-Id: Id592b29df36320d8697bd370252ada02612ba7d0
(cherry picked from commit 79fb6509a9c6ac5438d00d1eb858a4f5b014e6e3)
"}]
commit_message:
Don't create deployment when changing transport

Earlier when changing software config transport we used to
create a dummy deployment to push the metadata. However
this would not work with convergence as we take
resource lock for the update which updates the config
transport (another engine would try to update the resource
metadata for deployment when one engine has locked it).

Currently it works when updating transport as we ignore
the error in creating dummy deployment, but if there are
any new depoyments for the server they would fail.

We don't need to push the metadata as it would be pushed
when the there is a new/updated deployment.

Few additional changes in the patch:

- We don't need to ignore the error as servers are now
not replaced if the resource is in ERROR when nova server
is good/ACTIVE.
- Delete the existing tempurls and zaqar queues when
  changing transport.

Task: 41744
Change-Id: Id592b29df36320d8697bd370252ada02612ba7d0
(cherry picked from commit 79fb6509a9c6ac5438d00d1eb858a4f5b014e6e3)

Add support for juju resources

Simplestreams package is now installed via snap. By having the juju
resources for the snap package, it can benefit in offline environment.

Closes-Bug: 1921832

commit_message:
For containerized cni_ds set mountPropagation=HostToContainer to
let containers aware of the host's netns changes

Signed-off-by: yue.lg <yuelg@chinaunicom.cn>

commit_message:
set mac learning on ingress table to normal only for offload ports

commit 8fc80b7e132031d18c787b5be582c146d262de74 fixes mac learning
on ingress rule table when ovs offload is enabled. However the
change does not take into consideration if the port vnic type is
direct and profile has capability switchdev. So the action is
changed to Normal even for port of vnic_type normal.

Check vnic_type, profile of port binding and modify action to normal
only if vnic_type is direct and profile has switchdev capability.

Closes-Bug: #1931696
Change-Id: I49dbc7927d20610a3da0749d9a6b6351a66de388

In functional tests of the HA and DVR HA routers, when e.g.
failover is tested, we should always wait for routers to be in the
expected initial state (primary or backup) before router failover
will actually be done.
Without that, we may hit race condition when initial router's state
is enqueued but not processed yet and then state will be changed thus
no any action will be performed by L3 agent and test may fail.

for router state.

commit_message:
[Functional] Wait for the initial state of ha router before test

In functional tests of the HA and DVR HA routers, when e.g.
failover is tested, we should always wait for routers to be in the
expected initial state (primary or backup) before router failover
will actually be done.
Without that, we may hit race condition when initial router's state
is enqueued but not processed yet and then state will be changed thus
no any action will be performed by L3 agent and test may fail.

Additionally in that patch there is "master" instead of "primary" used
for router state.

Conflicts:
    neutron/tests/functional/agent/l3/test_dvr_router.py

Closes-Bug: #1939507
Change-Id: Ibd8f78fc822b04965c6a79b57b13be364934f64f
(cherry picked from commit b8ef8e722af761dd394064ab70e159aa05639e56)

commit_message:
Dropping lower constraints testing (stable Xena)

This topic was discussed on the ML and QA team proposed to
to test lower-constraints [1].

As decided in Neutron meeting, stable branches will drop this
CI job [2].

To pass gates, this also excludes consider-using-f-string from pylint
pep8 tests to avoid PEP8 failures with recent setuptools [3]

[1]http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-discuss/2020-December/019390.html
[2]http://eavesdrop.openstack.org/meetings/networking/2021/networking.2021-01-12-14.00.log.html
[3]http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-discuss/2021-September/024987.html

Change-Id: Ife8e2823f8ab43702f08eae6853efa3f86e3d43b

commit_message:
Fix privileges for MariaDB 10.5

"BINLOG MONITOR" and "SLAVE MONITOR" replace
"REPLICATION CLIENT" (which is now an alias for "BINLOG MONITOR").
The validation in Ansible MySQL collection is too simple to
understand aliases and breaks. Hence, let's use the canonical
names and adapt per service according to its needs.

Change-Id: I1175e4846384accd19942620dc155d0c5728e64b

commit_message:
Reset state during service nova-compute init

State to reset:
- IMAGE_BACKUP
- SHELVING
- SHELVING_IMAGE_PENDING_UPLOAD
- SHELVING_IMAGE_UPLOADING

Those are not managed during the service nova-compute init.
The impact for the user is blocked in transient state.

Related-Bug: #1938925
Change-Id: Ib49a18878961f74c074e1199695b00ae1be9f3e1

subject: Use service_net_map, not conditions on hard-coded networ names
messages: [{'account_id': 24245, 'date': '2021-10-08 11:09:48.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 25402, 'date': '2021-10-08 12:13:26.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2'}, {'account_id': 28223, 'date': '2021-10-11 07:29:04.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2 Workflow+1'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2021-10-08 11:09:48.000000000', 'message': "Use service_net_map, not conditions on hard-coded networ names

The ServiceNetMap defines the PublicNetwork, it defaults to
'external' and fall's back to ctlplane. Let's use the ServiceNetMap
when setting public_virtual_ip, tripleo::haproxy::public_virtual_ip
and tripleo::keepalived::public_virtual_ip.

This removes the conditionals on hard-coded network.name 'External'
in vip_data.j2. This will allow custom network names to be used,
either via overriding PublicNetwork in ServiceNetMap or using the
service_net_map_replace in network data.

Related-Bug: #1946239
Change-Id: I6f159d0b117233ba655bbb348a578ae071dd1103
"}]
commit_message:
Use service_net_map, not conditions on hard-coded networ names

The ServiceNetMap defines the PublicNetwork, it defaults to
'external' and fall's back to ctlplane. Let's use the ServiceNetMap
when setting public_virtual_ip, tripleo::haproxy::public_virtual_ip
and tripleo::keepalived::public_virtual_ip.

This removes the conditionals on hard-coded network.name 'External'
in vip_data.j2. This will allow custom network names to be used,
either via overriding PublicNetwork in ServiceNetMap or using the
service_net_map_replace in network data.

Related-Bug: #1946239
Change-Id: I6f159d0b117233ba655bbb348a578ae071dd1103

Check if SNAT iptables manager is initialized before processing the
IP NAT rules. If the router never had an external GW port, the DVR
GW in the SNAT namespace has not been created and the SNAT iptables
manager has not been initialized.

In this case, the IP NAT rules for centralized FIPs (to be applied
on the SNAT namespace) cannot be set.

Conflicts:

Change-Id: I426602514805d728f8cd78e42f2b0979b2101089
(cherry picked from commit f18edfdf450179f6bc8a47f3b143f2701bd93e0e)
(cherry picked from commit b9143c37e06567b1ce50f9e858c9289984bb8e4b)
'}]
commit_message:
[DVR] Check if SNAT iptables manager is initialized

Check if SNAT iptables manager is initialized before processing the
IP NAT rules. If the router never had an external GW port, the DVR
GW in the SNAT namespace has not been created and the SNAT iptables
manager has not been initialized.

In this case, the IP NAT rules for centralized FIPs (to be applied
on the SNAT namespace) cannot be set.

Conflicts:
    neutron/tests/functional/agent/l3/framework.py

Closes-Bug: #1945215
Change-Id: I426602514805d728f8cd78e42f2b0979b2101089
(cherry picked from commit f18edfdf450179f6bc8a47f3b143f2701bd93e0e)
(cherry picked from commit b9143c37e06567b1ce50f9e858c9289984bb8e4b)

commit_message:
Add 'generic' repos setup using yum_config module

This patch adds a new method for configuring generic repos in
repo-setup role, using yum_config module, from tripleo-repos.
The new repo-setup script was split into 3 parts:
 - cmd_before_setup, repo_setup and cmd_after_setup.
In future patches we plan to replace more script actions by
yum-config module operations.
A new variable was added to control which release file will be
using the new module.

Change-Id: I5ee8294cf761f660e779252aea0765c1f6715516
Signed-off-by: Douglas Viroel <dviroel@redhat.com>

commit_message:
[DVR] Check if SNAT iptables manager is initialized

Check if SNAT iptables manager is initialized before processing the
IP NAT rules. If the router never had an external GW port, the DVR
GW in the SNAT namespace has not been created and the SNAT iptables
manager has not been initialized.

In this case, the IP NAT rules for centralized FIPs (to be applied
on the SNAT namespace) cannot be set.

Conflicts:
    neutron/tests/functional/agent/l3/framework.py

Closes-Bug: #1945215
Change-Id: I426602514805d728f8cd78e42f2b0979b2101089
(cherry picked from commit f18edfdf450179f6bc8a47f3b143f2701bd93e0e)
(cherry picked from commit b9143c37e06567b1ce50f9e858c9289984bb8e4b)

commit_message:
CI: Remove ara integration

ara<1.0.0 fails to install because it requires SQLAlchemy<1.3.0 which is
not compatible with train upper constraints. Since this branch is not
actively used we can remove it.

Change-Id: Ieb9f8f197f588dd2a4191bff777d510258f5bd6d

subject: Handle symlinks in kolla extra configuration
messages:
[{'account_id': 33466, 'date': '2021-08-09 08:22:33.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 33466, 'date': '2021-08-09 10:42:14.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 2.'}, {'account_id': 14826, 'date': '2021-08-11 10:01:26.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

The molecule job timed out, is there some infinite loop in the code?'}, {'account_id': 33466, 'date': '2021-08-12 15:23:16.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

> Patch Set 2:
> 
> The molecule job timed out, is there some infinite loop in the code?

The timeout is triggered by the combination of the follow being enabled in the find task and the task running on / for the InfluxDB element (result of https://opendev.org/openstack/kayobe/src/branch/master/ansible/roles/kolla-openstack/vars/main.yml#L102 and the kolla_extra_config_path not having a value set).

After some investigation it looks like file system loops might be the culprit here, in particular in /sys and /proc.'}, {'account_id': 33466, 'date': '2021-09-24 07:49:52.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 3.'}, {'account_id': 14826, 'date': '2021-10-05 09:30:26.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3: Code-Review-1

(7 comments)

Thanks. I wonder if it would be simpler to do something like this:

* recursive find of files, following links
* recursive find of links, following links
* stat links, filter for files
* combine'}, {'account_id': 33466, 'date': '2021-10-11 10:02:29.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3:

(7 comments)

> Patch Set 3: Code-Review-1
> 
> (7 comments)
> 
> Thanks. I wonder if it would be simpler to do something like this:
> 
> * recursive find of files, following links
> * recursive find of links, following links
> * stat links, filter for files
> * combine

Hi Mark,

The problem is the follow option combined with recursion for find, i.e. even simple file find with path set to / and recursion/follow enabled will never finish.
Because of that, this patch is a little bit convoluted for what is trying to achieve, as it tries to work around the problem. Patch set 2 was cleaner/simpler as it only used a single find call with recurse/follow enabled.

The issue stems from the find being able to filter/exclude after the results have been found - once it gets stuck in a loop the filtering/exclusion may never happen. There is an existing PR that addresses this specific shortcoming https://github.com/ansible/ansible/pull/52334 but it looks like it has not been merged yet.'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2021-08-09 08:22:33.000000000', 'message': 'Handle symlinks in kolla extra configuration

Due to the default value of the file_type parameter in the
find module [1] symlinks in the kolla extra configuration
are not processed currently.

This change expands the scope of the find call to all files and
adds a stat task to help filter the results as find by itself
is not able to determine the underlying type of the symlink
target (i.e. directory, regular file, etc).

[1] https://docs.ansible.com/ansible/latest/collections/ansible/builtin/find_module.html

Story: 2009102
Task: 42952
Change-Id: I3a168c374dad0131ca99c163522b1e4808301a4b
'}, {'created': '2021-08-09 10:42:14.000000000', 'message': 'Handle symlinks in kolla extra configuration

is not able to determine the underlying type of the symlink
target (i.e. directory, regular file, etc).

[1] https://docs.ansible.com/ansible/latest/collections/ansible/builtin/find_module.html

Story: 2009102
Task: 42952
Change-Id: I3a168c374dad0131ca99c163522b1e4808301a4b
'}, {'created': '2021-09-24 07:49:52.000000000', 'message': 'Handle symlinks in kolla extra configuration

Due to the default value of the file_type parameter in the
find module [1] symlinks in the kolla extra configuration
are not processed currently.

This change expands the scope of the inital find call to all
files and filters out known loop directories.
Second find call with restricted depth is used to traverse
symlink directories.
Stat tasks help filter the results as find by itself
is not able to determine the underlying type of the symlink
target (i.e. directory, regular file, etc).

[1] https://docs.ansible.com/ansible/latest/collections/ansible/builtin/find_module.html

Story: 2009102
Task: 42952
Change-Id: I3a168c374dad0131ca99c163522b1e4808301a4b
'}]
commit_message:
Handle symlinks in kolla extra configuration

Due to the default value of the file_type parameter in the
find module [1] symlinks in the kolla extra configuration
are not processed currently.

This change expands the scope of the inital find call to all
files and filters out known loop directories.
Second find call with restricted depth is used to traverse
symlink directories.
Stat tasks help filter the results as find by itself
is not able to determine the underlying type of the symlink
target (i.e. directory, regular file, etc).

[1] https://docs.ansible.com/ansible/latest/collections/ansible/builtin/find_module.html

Story: 2009102
Task: 42952
Change-Id: I3a168c374dad0131ca99c163522b1e4808301a4b

subject: Limit jsonschema package to versions older than 4.2.0
messages:
[{'account_id': 30674, 'date': '2021-10-05 11:51:59.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 22873, 'date': '2021-10-05 19:14:28.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1: Code-Review-1

after a consideration, this is a bug in tempest, the tempest's function:
https://opendev.org/openstack/tempest/src/commit/a7bcabc8976e6e646d5e4379e3289b43586261c1/tempest/lib/common/jsonschema_validator.py#L34

uses a non public interface (compat.py):
https://github.com/Julian/jsonschema/blob/v3.2.0/jsonschema/compat.py

which got removed and therefore it's failing.

In the year when it was added - https://opendev.org/openstack/tempest/commit/f9ded3536646bb3998325f3417ef4ed588e05b7d
the interface wasn't marked as non public back then - that got changed in 2018 - https://github.com/Julian/jsonschema/commit/3c9b61c4ef302cf3463f8d82b7976be7e3400147#diff-0b60cfc7f89b490c3e18c14d830f4619c1f75ae9876b92cae8065b9c8a8004f5

It seems that the compat.py module was just for py2/3 compatibility."}, {'account_id': 8556, 'date': '2021-10-05 19:35:12.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1: Code-Review-1

> Patch Set 1: Code-Review-1
> 
> after a consideration, this is a bug in tempest, the tempest's function:
> https://opendev.org/openstack/tempest/src/commit/a7bcabc8976e6e646d5e4379e3289b43586261c1/tempest/lib/common/jsonschema_validator.py#L34
> 
> uses a non public interface (compat.py):
> https://github.com/Julian/jsonschema/blob/v3.2.0/jsonschema/compat.py
> 
> which got removed and therefore it's failing.
> 
> In the year when it was added - https://opendev.org/openstack/tempest/commit/f9ded3536646bb3998325f3417ef4ed588e05b7d
> the interface wasn't marked as non public back then - that got changed in 2018 - https://github.com/Julian/jsonschema/commit/3c9b61c4ef302cf3463f8d82b7976be7e3400147#diff-0b60cfc7f89b490c3e18c14d830f4619c1f75ae9876b92cae8065b9c8a8004f5
> 
> It seems that the compat.py module was just for py2/3 compatibility.

yeah that was change in jsonschema which break the tempest code so we can change that code in tempest so that it work with newer tempest also.

For old tempest tag, we saw this issue in stable/stein also where some issue in how constraints are enforced in virtual env - https://review.opendev.org/c/openstack/devstack/+/812092

I will say for tempest, instead of limiting the jsonschema version in requirement which is already handled by the upper-constraints we should fix the code to work with latest and old jsonschema"}, {'account_id': 22873, 'date': '2021-10-07 07:26:17.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

I pushed a patch to fix this:
https://review.opendev.org/c/openstack/tempest/+/812804

It's affecting also stackviz project, not just interop/refstack ones (so far)."}, {'account_id': 30674, 'date': '2021-10-11 09:22:33.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

(1 comment)'}, {'account_id': 30674, 'date': '2021-10-11 09:22:53.000000000', 'content': 'Abandoned

Fix here: https://review.opendev.org/c/openstack/tempest/+/812804'}]

When discover-tempest-config is called it fails with the following
error: "AttributeError: module jsonschema has no attribute compat".
The error is caused by new version 4.2.0 of jsonchema package.

commit_message:
Limit jsonschema package to versions older than 4.2.0

When discover-tempest-config is called it fails with the following
error: "AttributeError: module jsonschema has no attribute compat".
The error is caused by new version 4.2.0 of jsonchema package.

This patch fixes this issue by limiting jsonschema package used
by tempest only to versions older than 4.2.0.

Change-Id: I67d7219be440af4e7070a41ab9476e2811773184

subject: Add a timeout for waiting volume snapshot ready
revisions:
[{'created': '2021-10-10 14:19:46.000000000', 'message': 'Add a timeout for waiting volume snapshot ready

Endlessly waiting for a volume snapshot being
ready is not user friendly. This PS adds a timeout
and quits if a user defined timeout has met.

Closes-bug: #1946546
Change-Id: I1e82f7d2f15e90d0aaa8a9e673f4e92879d37f2d
'}]
commit_message:
Add a timeout for waiting volume snapshot ready

Endlessly waiting for a volume snapshot being
ready is not user friendly. This PS adds a timeout
and quits if a user defined timeout has met.

Closes-bug: #1946546
Change-Id: I1e82f7d2f15e90d0aaa8a9e673f4e92879d37f2d

commit_message:
Remove cinder from service names

In devstack job, cinder is not a valid service name and logs error
in gate[1] so remove it.

2021-09-28 05:44:47.791807 | controller | + functions-common:service_check:1603      :   for service in ${ENABLED_SERVICES//,/ }
2021-09-28 05:44:47.795506 | controller | + functions-common:service_check:1605      :   sudo systemctl is-enabled devstack@cinder.service
2021-09-28 05:44:47.809647 | controller | Failed to get unit file state for devstack@cinder.service: No such file or directory

[1] https://e978bdcfc0235dcd9417-6560bc3b6382c1d289b358872777ca09.ssl.cf1.rackcdn.com/801989/7/check/tempest-integrated-storage/779d1e7/job-output.txt

Change-Id: I7ca105201d82b72c7e56778425d3bce7c76047db

commit_message:
tools: Fix use of continue

continue is not used in a proper context here (outside of loop). Use
null cmd instead to simply fall through the pip installation.

Signed-off-by: Michal Berger <michallinuxstuff@gmail.com>
Change-Id: Iaea2e5c0177b475edf19d08d71933a74debbb5d9

subject: Don't create deployment when changing transport
messages: [{'account_id': 30073, 'date': '2021-10-10 22:01:50.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 30073, 'date': '2021-10-10 23:32:29.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:\n\nrecheck'}, {'account_id': 28223, 'date': '2021-10-11 06:24:43.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+1'}, {'account_id': 8833, 'date': '2021-10-11 06:33:56.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2 Workflow+1'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2021-10-10 22:01:50.000000000', 'message': "Don't create deployment when changing transport

Earlier when changing software config transport we used to
create a dummy deployment to push the metadata. However
this would not work with convergence as we take
resource lock for the update which updates the config
transport (another engine would try to update the resource
metadata for deployment when one engine has locked it).

Currently it works when updating transport as we ignore
the error in creating dummy deployment, but if there are
any new depoyments for the server they would fail.

We don't need to push the metadata as it would be pushed
when the there is a new/updated deployment.

Few additional changes in the patch:

- We don't need to ignore the error as servers are now
not replaced if the resource is in ERROR when nova server
is good/ACTIVE.
- Delete the existing tempurls and zaqar queues when
  changing transport.

Task: 41744
Change-Id: Id592b29df36320d8697bd370252ada02612ba7d0
(cherry picked from commit 79fb6509a9c6ac5438d00d1eb858a4f5b014e6e3)
"}]
commit_message:
Don't create deployment when changing transport

Earlier when changing software config transport we used to
create a dummy deployment to push the metadata. However
this would not work with convergence as we take
resource lock for the update which updates the config
transport (another engine would try to update the resource
metadata for deployment when one engine has locked it).

Currently it works when updating transport as we ignore
the error in creating dummy deployment, but if there are
any new depoyments for the server they would fail.

We don't need to push the metadata as it would be pushed
when the there is a new/updated deployment.

Few additional changes in the patch:

- We don't need to ignore the error as servers are now
not replaced if the resource is in ERROR when nova server
is good/ACTIVE.
- Delete the existing tempurls and zaqar queues when
  changing transport.

Task: 41744
Change-Id: Id592b29df36320d8697bd370252ada02612ba7d0
(cherry picked from commit 79fb6509a9c6ac5438d00d1eb858a4f5b014e6e3)

[{'created': '2021-10-08 03:25:06.000000000', 'message': 'the vif_name error leads virsh domifstat cant work

Netronome SmartNIC Enablement
As far the vif_name is tapxxx, it dont match the target port name. The external ML2 plugin
dont send the devname, so i change the vif_name to  the nic vfr_name. It can set the correct
target port name.

Fixes BUG1945586

Signed-off-by: peng zhang <peng.zhang@corigine.com>
Change-Id: I843fe5d8e6ae4d4710a2fb197bd9bafd80dcc5e6

dont send the devname, so i change the vif_name to  the nic vfr_name. It can set the correct
target port name.

'}]
commit_message:
the vif_name error leads virsh domifstat cant work

Netronome SmartNIC Enablement
As far the vif_name is tapxxx, it dont match the target port name. The external ML2 plugin
dont send the devname, so i change the vif_name to  the nic vfr_name. It can set the correct
target port name.

Fixes BUG1945586

Signed-off-by: peng zhang <peng.zhang@corigine.com>
Change-Id: I843fe5d8e6ae4d4710a2fb197bd9bafd80dcc5e6

messages:
[{'account_id': 6773, 'date': '2021-10-06 15:04:18.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 6773, 'date': '2021-10-07 08:16:49.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 2.'}, {'account_id': 6773, 'date': '2021-10-07 08:51:24.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 3.'}, {'account_id': 6773, 'date': '2021-10-07 09:09:30.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 4.'}, {'account_id': 6773, 'date': '2021-10-07 09:27:34.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 5: Commit message was updated.'}, {'account_id': 6773, 'date': '2021-10-07 09:28:33.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 6.'}, {'account_id': 16688, 'date': '2021-10-07 09:59:42.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 6:

Hi Lucas and Daniel. I think [1] and this patch are clashing. What solution do you want to propose?

[1] is easier and doesn't move the FIP event to the maintenance worker, and eventually could be easier to revert when OVN implements a MAC_Binding aging method, right?

[1]https://review.opendev.org/c/openstack/neutron/+/812805"}, {'account_id': 6773, 'date': '2021-10-07 10:11:38.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 6: Workflow-1

This approach is an alternative to https://review.opendev.org/c/openstack/neutron/+/812805. We are investigating what is best atm.'}, {'account_id': 6773, 'date': '2021-10-07 12:12:22.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 6:

Let's go with the daniel's approach, it's better as it gets rid of the MAC_Binding monitoring completely"}, {'account_id': 6773, 'date': '2021-10-07 12:12:28.000000000', 'content': 'Abandoned'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2021-10-06 15:04:18.000000000', 'message': 'WIP: [OVN] Move the MAC_Bindings monitoring to the maintenance IDL

In order to help with the memory usage in ML2/OVN this patch is moving the
monitoring of the MAC_Bindings table to the maintenance IDL, meaning that,
instead of monitoring this table on every neutron worker as before, we are
now only monitoring it in one worker (the maintenance one) per chassis.

Change-Id: I5b6780d66cf6e472e2665a649b63e8e6f5cc52b3
Signed-off-by: Lucas Alvares Gomes <lucasagomes@gmail.com>

worker as before, we are now only monitoring it in one worker (the
maintenance one) per chassis.

Closes-Bug: #1946344
Change-Id: I5b6780d66cf6e472e2665a649b63e8e6f5cc52b3
Signed-off-by: Lucas Alvares Gomes <lucasagomes@gmail.com>
'}]
commit_message:
[OVN] Move the MAC_Bindings monitoring to the maintenance IDL

In order to help with the memory usage in ML2/OVN this patch is
moving the monitoring of the MAC_Bindings table to the maintenance
IDL, meaning that, instead of monitoring this table on every neutron
worker as before, we are now only monitoring it in one worker (the
maintenance one) per chassis.

Closes-Bug: #1946344
Change-Id: I5b6780d66cf6e472e2665a649b63e8e6f5cc52b3
Signed-off-by: Lucas Alvares Gomes <lucasagomes@gmail.com>

messages: [{'account_id': 10135, 'date': '2021-10-07 08:46:12.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 30491, 'date': '2021-10-07 09:52:23.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2'}, {'account_id': 7118, 'date': '2021-10-10 22:48:39.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2 Workflow+1\n\n(1 comment)'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2021-10-07 08:46:12.000000000', 'message': 'nova: Ensure each compute uses a unique iSCSI initiator

The current initiator name embedded in our CI images is not unique at
present and can often cause failures during live migrations with
attached volumes. This change ensures the name is unique by running
iscsi-iname again and overwriting the existing name.

We could potentially do this during the image build process itself but
given that devstack systems are not supposed to be multi-purpose this
should be safe to do during the devstack run.

NOTE(lyarwood): Conflict due to
If2f74f146a166b9721540aaf3f1f9fce3030525c not being present on
stable/wallaby.

(cherry picked from commit 714826d1a27085ba2384ca495c876588d77f0d27)
(cherry picked from commit ee629cc77554b18cfca77506d1531f99523d2a58)
(cherry picked from commit a41fff99b35a2723348c933dc6c37ccf218e280f)
(cherry picked from commit 43364b7198a90b16a53f6e89d79238bd40a76953)
'}]
commit_message:
nova: Ensure each compute uses a unique iSCSI initiator

The current initiator name embedded in our CI images is not unique at
present and can often cause failures during live migrations with
attached volumes. This change ensures the name is unique by running
iscsi-iname again and overwriting the existing name.

We could potentially do this during the image build process itself but
given that devstack systems are not supposed to be multi-purpose this
should be safe to do during the devstack run.

NOTE(lyarwood): Conflict due to
If2f74f146a166b9721540aaf3f1f9fce3030525c not being present on
stable/wallaby.

Conflicts:
    lib/nova

Closes-Bug: #1945983
Change-Id: I9ed26a17858df96c04be9ae52bf2e33e023869a5
(cherry picked from commit 714826d1a27085ba2384ca495c876588d77f0d27)
(cherry picked from commit ee629cc77554b18cfca77506d1531f99523d2a58)
(cherry picked from commit a41fff99b35a2723348c933dc6c37ccf218e280f)
(cherry picked from commit 43364b7198a90b16a53f6e89d79238bd40a76953)

commit_message:
Fix displaying usage for make_cert.sh

Now, if no arguments are passed to make_cert.sh script, it will fail on:

  tools/make_cert.sh: line 30: [: missing `]'

and might go on with generating certs depending on the bash settings.
It is fixed within this patch.

Change-Id: I62bf9c972ebd1644da622439e05114f245f20809

commit_message:
Rehome functions to enable Neutron's Trunk service plugin

Those functions were part of the neutron devstack plugin but we
discussed on the neutron team meeting [1] to move it to the Devstack
repo as it's mature enough now.

[1] https://meetings.opendev.org/meetings/networking/2021/networking.2021-10-05-14.00.log.html#l-156

Change-Id: I35446adad1d8a7fed142d834de20c48b611015a5

commit_message:
nova: Ensure each compute uses a unique iSCSI initiator

The current initiator name embedded in our CI images is not unique at
present and can often cause failures during live migrations with
attached volumes. This change ensures the name is unique by running
iscsi-iname again and overwriting the existing name.

We could potentially do this during the image build process itself but
given that devstack systems are not supposed to be multi-purpose this
should be safe to do during the devstack run.

NOTE(lyarwood): Conflict due to
If2f74f146a166b9721540aaf3f1f9fce3030525c not being present on
stable/wallaby.

commit_message:
nova: Ensure each compute uses a unique iSCSI initiator

The current initiator name embedded in our CI images is not unique at
present and can often cause failures during live migrations with
attached volumes. This change ensures the name is unique by running
iscsi-iname again and overwriting the existing name.

We could potentially do this during the image build process itself but
given that devstack systems are not supposed to be multi-purpose this
should be safe to do during the devstack run.

NOTE(lyarwood): Conflict due to
If2f74f146a166b9721540aaf3f1f9fce3030525c not being present on
stable/wallaby.

Conflicts:
    lib/nova

commit_message:
Add cephadm_adopt tag to the ceph related upgrade tasks

The purpose of this change is automating the cephadm adoption during the
FFU process. In particular the cephadm_adopt tag is added and it's supposed
to be run as any other regular external_upgrade task using the
cephadm_adopt playbook against the whole Ceph cluster.

Change-Id: I65249d389316345ee46d4b18929ba09c94a22bfc

commit_message:
Update jeepyb to trigger Gerrit 3.3 image builds

We are planning to upgrade our Gerrit install to 3.3. Jeepyb shouldn't
trigger 3.2 builds once that is done as those images won't be used. Bump
to 3.3 as a result.

Depends-On: https://review.opendev.org/c/opendev/system-config/+/813072
Change-Id: If69016e7a14b98829ccc52ead3f532c9470ae912

revisions:
[{'created': '2021-10-10 16:45:47.000000000', 'message': "Helm 3 - Fix Additional Job Labels

If labels are not specified on a Job, kubernetes defaults them
to include the labels of their underlying Pod template. Helm 3
injects metadata into all resources [0] including a
`app.kubernetes.io/managed-by: Helm` label. Thus when kubernetes
sees a Job's labels they are no longer empty and thus do not get
defaulted to the underlying Pod template's labels. This is a
problem since Job labels are depended on by
- Armada pre-upgrade delete hooks
- Armada wait logic configurations
- kubernetes-entrypoint dependencies

Thus, for Job templates previously missed, this adds labels matching
the underlying Pod template to retain the same labels that were
present with Helm 2.

[0]: https://github.com/helm/helm/pull/7649

Change-Id: Ie438b449a3d9853d786215d40a39c32d164e9950
"}, {'created': '2021-10-10 17:04:55.000000000', 'message': "Helm 3 - Fix Additional Job Labels

If labels are not specified on a Job, kubernetes defaults them
to include the labels of their underlying Pod template. Helm 3
injects metadata into all resources [0] including a
`app.kubernetes.io/managed-by: Helm` label. Thus when kubernetes
sees a Job's labels they are no longer empty and thus do not get
defaulted to the underlying Pod template's labels. This is a
problem since Job labels are depended on by
- Armada pre-upgrade delete hooks
- Armada wait logic configurations
- kubernetes-entrypoint dependencies

Thus, for Job templates previously missed, this adds labels matching
the underlying Pod template to retain the same labels that were
present with Helm 2.

[0]: https://github.com/helm/helm/pull/7649

Change-Id: Ie438b449a3d9853d786215d40a39c32d164e9950
"}]
commit_message:
Helm 3 - Fix Additional Job Labels

If labels are not specified on a Job, kubernetes defaults them
to include the labels of their underlying Pod template. Helm 3
injects metadata into all resources [0] including a
`app.kubernetes.io/managed-by: Helm` label. Thus when kubernetes
sees a Job's labels they are no longer empty and thus do not get
defaulted to the underlying Pod template's labels. This is a
problem since Job labels are depended on by
- Armada pre-upgrade delete hooks
- Armada wait logic configurations
- kubernetes-entrypoint dependencies

Thus, for Job templates previously missed, this adds labels matching
the underlying Pod template to retain the same labels that were
present with Helm 2.

[0]: https://github.com/helm/helm/pull/7649

Change-Id: Ie438b449a3d9853d786215d40a39c32d164e9950

commit_message:
Allow configuring secure RBAC in placement

Adding new parameter EnforceSecureRbac to support for project
persona of secure RBAC in placement-api.

To make the secure RBAC work, 'oslo_policy/enforce_new_defaults' and
'oslo_policy/enforce_scope' are also required to be enabled with
'enforce_secure_rbac' in placement.

Partially Implements: blueprint secure-rbac

Change-Id: I9862ad83b3e12012be01e49cc1c16b505c7c40cf
(cherry picked from commit 8ad58943df409c5e8d325e1b0f379e73b565a78f)

commit_message:
Add support for configuring tuned profile

This is only supported on CentOS for now due to limitations of the
Ansible role used to configure tuned.

Change-Id: Ie07c5f467975f8da2f720e70c94cea6285981d72
Co-Authored-By: Pierre Riteau <pierre@stackhpc.com>
Story: 2007853
Task: 40155

I think this is a valid path to head down given the simplicity involved, just needs unit testing from my point of view.'}, {'account_id': 5805, 'date': '2021-09-30 16:10:45.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

Thank you for the reviews. The issue we encountered was with the snmp port actions. With this patch in place we have stopped seeing the failures we experienced. I agree with Julia here as the snmp actions are only power control I feel a queueing system might be over kill, where with IPMI it makes more sense as there are many different operations that can be performed.'}, {'account_id': 11655, 'date': '2021-10-06 16:31:54.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

> Patch Set 1:
> 
> Thank you for the reviews. The issue we encountered was with the snmp port actions. With this patch in place we have stopped seeing the failures we experienced. I agree with Julia here as the snmp actions are only power control I feel a queueing system might be over kill, where with IPMI it makes more sense as there are many different operations that can be performed.

Makes sense, and if *memory* serves, in most of the snmp power strip modules I've played with, you could still toggle different ports on the same controller without any issues, it was just because you were touching the same port is where things got weird.

I concur, queuing is overkill in that scenario."}, {'account_id': 11655, 'date': '2021-10-06 18:06:23.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1: Code-Review-1

(3 comments)

Suggestion on the config parameter value and note that we need to at least add something into the tests. Other than that, I'm good with adding a literal configurable sleep in since this is a semi-known behavior of some PDUs as well as a note regarding that the setting may be useful if attached machine power supplies are substantial enough (i.e. have sufficient capacitor storage) to handle brownouts."}, {'account_id': 5805, 'date': '2021-10-06 19:18:15.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 2.'}, {'account_id': 11655, 'date': '2021-10-06 19:26:27.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Code-Review-1

commit_message:
add snmp power action delay

This patch adds a new snmp configuration value for power_action_delay.
It is a pause before power on and again after power off.

some of PDU equipment fails to perform correctly if commands are sent to quickly.
This patch add a configurable delay to correct that behavior.

Change-Id: I433af25f03e5baf96c0868a28b99be290adca5eb

[{'created': '2021-10-07 05:27:34.000000000', 'message': 'Do not append filename parameter to image URL when using local file

Currently Ironic always adds a filename parameter to virtual media
image URL, for example:
http://localhost/redfish/boot.iso?filename=file.iso. This is useful
on certain BMCs which require a ".iso" suffix in the image URL
especially when using swift as the image source.
This should not be neccessary with file based virtual media images
and adding this parameter can cause issues in BMCs which do not
accept special characters such as "=" and "?" in virtual image URL.
This change alters Ironic's behaviour to only add the filename
parameter if swift backing store is used for the image.

commit_message:
Do not append filename parameter to image URL when using local file

Currently Ironic always adds a filename parameter to virtual media
image URL, for example:
http://localhost/redfish/boot.iso?filename=file.iso. This is useful
on certain BMCs which require a ".iso" suffix in the image URL
especially when using swift as the image source.
This should not be neccessary with file based virtual media images
and adding this parameter can cause issues in BMCs which do not
accept special characters such as "=" and "?" in virtual image URL.
This change alters Ironic's behaviour to only add the filename
parameter if swift backing store is used for the image.

Story: 2009278
Task: 43547

Change-Id: I3338bdb6a24d9695ce32d205221183b9b876bcc8

[{'account_id': 11628, 'date': '2021-02-04 23:26:28.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 6926, 'date': '2021-02-09 11:31:10.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+1'}, {'account_id': 6681, 'date': '2021-02-10 15:56:03.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2'}, {'account_id': 14985, 'date': '2021-02-15 14:50:02.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1: Code-Review-1

I'd just roll this into the initial patch rather than having two if possible"}, {'account_id': 11628, 'date': '2021-02-22 18:20:12.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

> Patch Set 1: Code-Review-1
> 
> I'd just roll this into the initial patch rather than having two if possible

This is a separate feature, developed after the base unbound patch. It is not required for the base unbound patch to be useful.
It is an OpenStack best practice to propose features in separate patches.
This allows for easier reverts, patch tracking, more complete release notes, and smaller reviews.
I think it is best to have this as a separate patch from the base unbound functionality."}, {'account_id': 14985, 'date': '2021-02-22 18:52:49.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

I would agree if we had an unbound role already defined. Since it has yet to land and requires changes, it's better from our standpoint not to contribute to having more CI load due to extra patches.  Also if there is any desire to backport these, it'd be better to have it as one patch."}, {'account_id': 11628, 'date': '2021-02-23 20:04:25.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Patch Set 1 was rebased'}, {'account_id': 11628, 'date': '2021-02-25 17:16:07.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2:

Alex's comment appears to be slowing down the review process for important patches.

I would like to point out the OpenStack documentation on the topic: https://docs.openstack.org/contributors/code-and-documentation/patch-best-practices.html

Since I don't want the base feature delayed any longer, I will abandon these feature patches and revisit once the base has been merged."}, {'account_id': 11628, 'date': '2021-02-25 17:16:32.000000000', 'content': 'Abandoned

This is interfering with other patches, will revisit at a later date.'}, {'account_id': 14985, 'date': '2021-02-25 17:18:01.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2:

It's not slowing anything as the parent patch is still requiring work. Keeping this patch continue to be separate while not even having support for the original simply wastes reviewers time and resources."}, {'account_id': 6681, 'date': '2021-07-26 19:17:24.000000000', 'content': 'Restored'}, {'account_id': 6681, 'date': '2021-07-26 19:17:29.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 3: Patch Set 2 was rebased.'}, {'account_id': 13995, 'date': '2021-10-04 18:07:44.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3:

commit_message:
Add DNS resolver forwarding support to Unbound

This patch adds support for DNS resolver forwarding to the tripleo_unbound
role. This allows the configuration of "upstream" dns resolvers that
TripleO Unbound will query if it doesn't have a local answer to a query.
If forwarders are not defined, Unbound will perform a standard recursive
DNS resolution.

Change-Id: I04d9b2d198f83882a8a4ca7ff4c196d06f8c9ee2

commit_message:
Add environments/deployed-networks.yaml

The environment can be used alongside
environments/deployed-ports.j2.yaml for scenarios where openstack
overcloud network provision was not used, and in scenarios where Neutron
is not installed.

Change-Id: Iad3d2e4ba4108b0de5481b7408342b7c8d209a36
Signed-off-by: James Slagle <jslagle@redhat.com>

commit_message:
Add some missing bind service parameters

There are some standard best practices parameters for the bind worker
instances that were not being configured. This patch also breaks the
configuration up to support easier upgrading/isolate configuration
function groups.

Change-Id: I4bf791706794018fb5d774ef5cfb3bd31e8803a9

commit_message:
Don't pass --network-ports in node provision

Since [0] --network-ports is deprecated.

We are currently receiving a deprecated warning[1]
~~~
DEPRECATED option "--network-ports" detected.
This option is no longer used, network ports are always managed.
~~~

It is not needed to tripleo_overcloud_node_provision_network_ports
in tripleo_overcloud_node_provision role anymore.

[0] https://review.opendev.org/c/openstack/python-tripleoclient/+/803946
[1] https://logserver.rdoproject.org/openstack-periodic-integration-stable1/opendev.org/openstack/tripleo-ci/master/periodic-tripleo-ci-centos-8-ovb-3ctlr_1comp-featureset001-wallaby/7b85778/logs/undercloud/home/zuul/overcloud_node_provision.log.txt.gz

Change-Id: I136b6d62a78ddb4926ce05b2b93f47b47b407bbe

127.0.0.1:9001 is returned instead of a valid endpoint URI.   This
behavior breaks openstacksdk starting with 0.31.2 but wasn't seen
with previous version.

commit_message:
Configure api_base_uri to DesignateEndpoint URI

Configure api_base_uri to DesignateEndpoint URI because default
127.0.0.1:9001 is returned instead of a valid endpoint URI.   This
behavior breaks openstacksdk starting with 0.31.2 but wasn't seen
with previous version.

Change-Id: Ie531ea68a3d8e98e40a58d9c5ee484eb134abb96
(cherry picked from commit 33d9d19a498e3d4e75204f892a065a559787bfed)

commit_message:
bnr enabled ramdisk as deploy interfaces on the ironic/undercloud

ReaR can be configured to use PXE to boot the servers for restoration.
Currently, the default restoration process is using an iso image.
The purpose of this patch is to configure ReaR to PXE boot and use
Ironic to boot/recover the server automatically

Change-Id: I15774ed1988c2765b1e18c2b5db0ec6ea3e9a02c
(cherry picked from commit 17fd85abd32620ae62f232ddcc7fa89344ae44d5)
